The course covers the core concepts (such as scroll(), view(), etc), and shares several practical examples. All of the episodes are available to watchÂ now.

Salma Alam-Naylor

items.content:
ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹641 â€” May 1, 2024 | Read on the web

An Alternative Proposal for CSS Masonry â€” Last week we shared WebKitâ€™s thoughts on how to approach creating masonry type layouts in CSS. Now the Chrome team has weighed in, stating that â€œimplementing it as part of the CSS Grid specification [..] would be a mistakeâ€, and they think it should be its own separate layout method defined using display: masonry or somethingÂ similar.

Rachel Andrew (Chrome)

ğŸ¤” Kevin Powell has shared his thoughts over on his channel, highlighting the broader layout disagreement at play here. Plus, Chris Coyier has penned some feedback too.

Here's a Simple Video API for Your Next.js Application â€” Integrate a video player into your Next.js applications! Learn about HTML5 video tag, video.js library, and how you can unlock more functionality and performance with the ImageKit Video API. Deliver an optimized, buffer-free video stream everyÂ time.

ImageKit sponsor

The Popover API is Here â€” The Popover API now has broad support, and as such Chris gives us a brief overview of how it differs from <dialog> and how we may want to approach usingÂ it.

Chris Coyier

âš¡ï¸ Quick Links

  • ğŸ“± Soon you won't have to rearchitect your MPA into an SPA, thanks to same-origin cross-document view-transitions.
